title: [BUG] HIVECOTEV2 with n_jobs>1 crashes on internal dataset
body:
**Describe the bug**
I want to fit HIVECOTEV2 on an internal dataset in "df-list" format with two classes. Running it in a singe thread `HIVECOTEV2(time_limit_in_minutes=1)` works as expected and outputs no warnings or errors. However I want to speed it up with multiprocessing `HIVECOTEV2(time_limit_in_minutes=1, n_jobs=14)` but this creates `NumbaPendingDeprecationWarning`:s, overflow warnings and then crashes with a `PicklingError`.

**To Reproduce**
Unfortunate I can't share the data since it contains sensitive personal information, please tell me if I should check something in the data. Hopefully you can figure something out from the logs.

Load and verify data:
```python
samples = load_data()

check_raise(samples[0], "pd.DataFrame")
check_raise(samples, "df-list")

print(any([df.isnull().values.any() for df in samples]))  # False
print(any([~np.isfinite(df.values).all() for df in samples]))  # False
```

Fit single process creates a working model without any warnings or errors.
```python
model = HIVECOTEV2(time_limit_in_minutes=1)
model.fit(samples, np.array(targets, dtype=int))
```

Fit multiprocessing shows warnings and then crashes.
```python
model = HIVECOTEV2(time_limit_in_minutes=1, n_jobs=14)
model.fit(samples, np.array(targets, dtype=int))
```
